articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: The Trump administration plans to push European allies to buy more American weapons for Ukraine ahead of potential peace talks with Moscow, said two people with knowledge of the matter, a move that could improve Kyiv's negotiating position.
articles.title: Exclusive: US will push European allies to buy more arms for Ukraine, say sources

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said Palestinians would not have the right of return to the Gaza Strip under his proposal to redevelop the enclave, contradicting his own officials who had suggested Gazans would only be relocated temporarily.
articles.title: Trump says Palestinians would not have a right to return to Gaza

articles.author: Karen Lema
articles.description: Campaigning for the Philippines' midterm elections kicked off on Tuesday against a fractured political backdrop, heightened by a high-profile row among warring elites that culminated in last week's impeachment of Vice President Sara Duterte.
articles.title: Philippines kicks off election campaigning amid VP impeachment drama

articles.author: Michelle Nichols, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The United States has lifted a pause on food donations, the U.N. World Food Programme said, ending a suspension that an aid watchdog on Monday warned had left 500,000 metric tons of food currently at sea or ready to be shipped in limbo.
articles.title: U.S. lifts pause on food donations for World Food Programme

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A bus veered off a highway bridge into a polluted ravine in Guatemala City early on Monday, killing at least 51 people and trapping survivors, a spokesperson for the city's fire department said.
articles.title: At least 50 die in Guatemala after bus plunges off bridge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Egyptian Foreign Minister Badr Abdelatty told U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Monday that Arab states support Palestinians in rejecting U.S. President Donald Trump's plan to displace Palestinians in Gaza and take control of the enclave.
articles.title: Arab states reject Trump plan for Gaza, Egypt foreign minister tells Rubio

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Ukrainian drone attack damaged an industrial facility in Russia's southern region of Saratov, its governor said early on Tuesday, while a Ukrainian official said an oil refinery had been hit.
articles.title: Ukraine attack damages industrial facility in Russia's Saratov, regional governor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A teacher at a South Korean elementary school has admitted to stabbing a seven-year-old girl who was found in cardiac arrest and later died in hospital, a police official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: South Korean teacher admits to stabbing girl to death, police say

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: A woman in the U.S. accused internet personalities Tristan and Andrew Tate of conspiring to coerce her into sex work, luring her to Romania and defaming her after her testimony to Romanian authorities, according to a lawsuit filed on Monday.
articles.title: US woman sues Tate brothers, accuses them of luring her into sex work

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description:
Indonesia's appointment of an army general to run the national food procurement company has raised concerns about the expansion of military roles under President Prabowo Subianto, with a rights activist saying it also violated military laws.
Major General Novi Helmy Prasetya was named chief executive of Bulog, a powerful state logistics company in charge of government-controlled imports of rice and other important food staples, on the weekend, becoming the first active duty general in the role since the authoritarian regime of General Suharto.
articles.title: Indonesia general to head state food procurement company, sparking concerns on military role
